text: The Thangjing Hill or the Thangching Hill is a hill range in the southern province of Manipur. It is one of the most visited holy pilgrimage sites in Northeast India. People following Sanamahi religion used to climb the top of the peak to offer prayers to God Thangching, whose main temple is built on the peak.The God Lainingthou Thangching Koylellai ==References== Category:Meitei culture
title: Thangjing Hill
